snippet: Builders in Brooklyn are still required to include parking spots for new residential buildings.
abstract: Relationship that many Brooklynites have with their cars is different from that of their counterparts in Manhattan, and so, too, is the parking situation; while developers of residential buildings in Manhattan have not been compelled to provide parking facilities since the Clean Air Act of 1981, builders in Brooklyn must still accommodate a certain number of automobiles.
lead_paragraph: Builders in Brooklyn are still required to include parking spots for new residential buildings.
